snippet: Though the state came through the recession in better shape than most, residents worry about the economy, and most of all, a heroin epidemic.
abstract: Voters in New Hampshire, state that weathered recession better than many states and boasts relatively high levels of well-being, nonetheless report anxieties likely to influence course of primary; among worries are poverty of some residents and heroin epidemic sweeping state.
lead_paragraph: Though the state came through the recession in better shape than most, residents worry about the economy, and most of all, a heroin epidemic.

headline.main: In New Hampshire, an Anxious Political Landscape as Voting Nears
headline.print_headline: New Hampshire Vote Nears Amid Anxiety Across a State
